Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis with possible root of handle flange on left; interior: glazed black with two added red bands; top of rim reserved with two rows of black dots and black band at inner edge; exterior: brown band below lip; incised lotus-palmette cross with red on cuffs and petals of lotuses and petals of palmette.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Athens, Agora P 26542 (Agora XII, pl. 119 no. 1868). The suggested dates for the Polos Painter are c. 585-550 BC (Möller 2000, 226) and c. 575-565 BC (Boardman, J., Athenian Black Figure Vases. London, 1974, 19).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 335, no. B393)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 151, note 67, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0772) (Phase 1)
